Top Hotel Collections Taj Hotels Near Airport 5 Star Hotels Nearby Resorts View All Hotels In Mumbai List of Waterfalls near Mumbai Mumbai is a fast-paced city and people are always looking for a chance to enjoy the weekend and travel somewhere nearby preferably. And what is better than visiting waterfalls near Mumbai, all cosily (Read More) tucked up amidst surreal environment and pleasant climate. The gorgeous waterfalls are the most perfect way to escape the city blues and spend some quality time with friends, family and loved ones. Cascading down high cliffs, the silvery water forms a pool at the foothill where people sometimes take a dip and soak themselves in the pool. The enchanting waterfalls are a visual delight to the eyes and a favourite hangout place even among the locals. We have compiled an elaborate list of waterfalls near Mumbai. Check it out and head to any one now! Here is the list of 16 Waterfalls near Mumbai for a Picturesque Getaway 1. Bhagirath Falls, Mumbai Situated at a distance of 68 kms from Mumbai in Vangani, Bhagirath Falls is one of the most picturesque and enchanting waterfalls near Mumbai. Also known as Vangani Falls among the localites, the spot is a pretty popular sightseeing place in the city. Read More 2. Bhivpuri Waterfalls, Karjat Situated around 90 kms from Mumbai in Karjat, Bhivpuri Waterfalls is a mesmerising cascade of water from a cliff. Nestled amidst beauteous surroundings and lush greenery, these waterfalls near Mumbai is a popular place of tourism in the region. Distance from Mumbai: 66 km Read More 3. Pandavkada Falls, Mumbai Just an hour's drive from the city, Pandavkada Falls is one of the most popular waterfalls near Navi Mumbai. Nestled in between verdant green Pandavkada Hills, the waterfalls are a visual treat and ideal spot to relax and rejuvenate. Distance from Mumbai: 31 km Read More 4. Malshej falls, Malshej Ghat 3.5 /5 Rain, mist, fog and the cascading water falls amidst of woody forest together form the refreshing and fascinating Malshej falls. The mystical falls are situated at a distance of 127 kms from Mumbai. Distance from Mumbai: 127 km Read More Top Hotels In Mumbai Search Hotels Taj Hotels In Mumbai 6 options from ₹ 11,000 onwards Mumbai Hotels Near Airport 50 options from ₹ 898 onwards Best 5 Star Hotels in Mumbai 39 options from ₹ 6,228 onwards Best Resorts Near Mumbai For An Urban Getaway 26 options from ₹ 3,300 onwards Hotels In Bandra, Mumbai 50 options from ₹ 1,000 onwards Best Hotels in Mumbai 47 options from ₹ 3,750 onwards View All Hotels In Mumbai View All Hotels In Mumbai 5. Randha Falls, Bhandardara 3.4 /5 Another waterfall attraction in Bhandardara is the Randha Falls of the Pravara river situated around 164 kms from Mumbai. The clear water of the Pravara river ferociously falls from a height 170ft into a magnificent ravine. However, this waterfall near Mumbai is only attractive in the monsoons. Distance from Mumbai: 164 km Read More 6. Kune Waterfalls, Lonavala Kune Falls are the 14th highest waterfalls in India located in Lonavala with a total height of 200 metres. The enchanting waterfalls near Mumbai fall in three tiers amidst the backdrop of tantalising Sahyadris within the Lonavala-Khandala valley and makes up for an enchanting visual experience. Unfortunately, the road to the Kune Falls is under private and hence visitor entry is restricted. Distance from Mumbai: 80 km Read More 7. Bhilar Falls, Panchgani Bhilar Waterfalls is a seasonal waterfalls in Panchgani, Maharashtra that is only water fed from monsoons to winters. Located 248 kms from Mumbai, the waterfalls are a treat to the eyes and an ultimate place of peace, calm and tranquility. Distance from Mumbai: 246 km Read More 8. Dugarwadi Waterfalls, Nasik Situated at 177 kms from Mumbai in Nasik, Dugarwadi Waterfalls is a beautiful cascade of silvery water amidst verdant greenery, enveloped in mountains. These waterfalls near Mumbai are synonymous with natural beauty, calm and tranquillity. Distance from Mumbai: 185 km Read More 9. Thoseghar Falls, Pune Thoseghar Falls is situated in Thoseghar around 274 kms from Mumbai. Falling down a height of 500 metres, the waterfalls are a popular place for day picnic among the localites. Distance from Mumbai: 281 km Read More 10. Vihigaon Waterfall, Nasik Vihigaon Waterfall is a perfectly refreshing weekend getaway in the lap of nature's bounty near Nashik. The waterfall is known for its captivating natural beauty and the 120 feet fall where the visitors can engage in rappelling for about 30 minutes. The hike stretch to these waterfalls near Mumbai through the woods is also quite fascinating. Distance from Mumbai: 115 km Read More 11. Dabhosa Waterfall, Nasik Dabhosa Waterfall is situated near Nasik in Thane, Maharashtra, around 168 kms from Mumbai. Formed over Lendi River, the falls fall down a height of around 300 metres. The spot also facilitates adventure activities like Kayaking, Valley Crossing, Zip Line, fishing and trekking. Distance from Mumbai: 162 km Read More 12. Lingmala Falls, Mahabaleshwar 3.8 /5 The Falls lie on the Mahabaleshwar-Pune road, 256 kms from Mumbai in Panchgani. The stream here, in the fall, precipitates over the face of steep cliff, unbroken when the torrent is swollen by rain but otherwise, ordinarily divided by projecting rocks about one third of the way down into thin silver streaks and sprays often circled by rainbows. Distance from Mumbai: 256 km Read More 13. Chinaman's falls, Mahabaleshwar 3.6 /5 A visit to Mahabaleshwar is less or more incomplete without witnessing the tantalizing descend of the Chinaman's fall, one of the most significant falls in the state. These waterfalls near Mumbai are situated 261 kms away. Distance from Mumbai: 263 km Read More 14. Zenith Waterfalls, Karjat Situated in Khopoli near Karjat, Zenith Waterfall is one of the most beautiful waterfall sites in Maharashtra. These waterfalls near Mumbai can be reached through a short trek between ridges and troughs narrow pathways. Distance from Mumbai: 73 km Read More 15. Umbrella Falls, Bhandardara 3.5 /5 Located 163 kms from Mumbai in Bhandardara, the Umbrella Falls are the falls formed under the Wilson Dam and the force by which the water falls on the naturally placed rocks that gives an impression of an umbrella. Distance from Mumbai: 161 km Read More 16. Dhobi waterfall, Mahabaleshwar 3.6 /5 Situated 262 kms from Mumbai, these set of fascinating waterfalls connect Lodwick and Elphinston point and further join petit road with Old Mahabaleshwar road. Surrounded by greenery and rocks, these are ideal for a surreal experience amidst nature. Distance from Mumbai: 263 km Read More Which of these waterfalls near Mumbai have you visited?
